questions.question: What does the term 'accommodation' include in the context of the Act?

options.a: Hotel rooms
options.b: Residential and business accommodation
options.c: Public spaces
options.d: Educational institutions

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Reference: Section 2(1), definition of 'accommodation')

questions.question: Who is defined as a 'client' in the Act?

options.a: Any person present at an institution
options.b: Any person who conducts business with an employer
options.c: Any person providing services to an institution
options.d: Any person involved in legal proceedings

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Reference: Section 2(1), definition of 'client')

questions.question: What does the term 'sexual harassment' mean in the Act?

options.a: Any friendly gesture of a sexual nature
options.b: Unwelcome sexual advances that create an offensive or hostile environment
options.c: Consensual sexual relationships at the workplace
options.d: Any form of physical contact between co-workers

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Reference: Section 2(1), definition of 'sexual harassment')

questions.question: Who can lodge a sexual harassment claim under Section 5 of the Act?

options.a: Only workers employed for more than 2 years
options.b: Any person affiliated with an institution
options.c: Only clients who conduct business with an employer
options.d: Workers who allege they have been sexually harassed

questions.question: What must an employer do upon receiving a sexual harassment claim against a worker?

options.a: Ignore the claim if not supported by evidence
options.b: Notify the worker against whom the claim is made and initiate an investigation
options.c: Suspend the worker immediately
options.d: File a counterclaim against the complaining worker

questions.question: Who qualifies as a 'fit and proper person' under the Act?

options.a: Anyone with a clean criminal record
options.b: Anyone who is not bankrupt
options.c: Someone convicted of minor offenses
options.d: Someone with sound probity and competence

questions.question: What does the Act require an employer to do in Section 3?

options.a: Ensure workers are not sexually harassed
options.b: Provide monetary compensation to victims
options.c: Promote a friendly work environment
options.d: Offer self-defense classes to workers

questions.question: Who can make a complaint to the Tribunal under Section 27(1)(b)?

options.a: Anyone who feels offended by a worker's behavior
options.b: Someone alleging a breach of confidentiality by an institution
options.c: Anyone who believes their rights may be prejudiced
options.d: Someone who disagrees with an employer's decision

questions.question: Under Section 12(5)(a)(ii), what can an authorized officer do when investigating a complaint?

options.a: Interrogate anyone involved in the case
options.b: Inspect and take copies of relevant documents
options.c: Make an immediate arrest without a warrant
options.d: Close down the institution under investigation

questions.question: What action can the Tribunal take if a person refuses to answer questions during a hearing?

options.a: Issue a warning
options.b: Fine the person
options.c: Compel the person to answer
options.d: Dismiss the case

questions.question: Who is prohibited from making derogatory remarks towards the Tribunal?

options.a: Witnesses
options.b: Journalists
options.c: Defendants
options.d: Spectators

questions.question: What is the punishment for knowingly making a false sexual harassment claim or complaint under Section 41(1)?

options.a: Warning
options.b: Fine
options.c: Community service
options.d: Verbal reprimand

questions.question: Under Section 10(2), what is prohibited for a member of staff or a person in authority at an institution?

options.a: Offering scholarships to students
options.b: Subjecting students to rigorous training programs
options.c: Making it appear that preferential treatment is contingent upon sexual advances
options.d: Allowing students to choose their own coursework

questions.question: Who is defined as a 'worker' under the Act?

options.a: Only employees in the private sector
options.b: Any person engaged by an employer in any capacity
options.c: Only individuals with formal employment contracts
options.d: Only individuals above the age of 21

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Reference: Section 2(1), definition of 'worker')

questions.question: What is the maximum penalty for obstructing an authorized officer in the exercise of their functions?

options.a: Fine not exceeding one million dollars
options.b: Fine not exceeding five hundred thousand dollars
options.c: Fine not exceeding one hundred thousand dollars
options.d: Fine not exceeding two million dollars

questions.question: What must a person do before making a complaint under Section 27(1)(b)?

options.a: Provide evidence of the alleged misconduct
options.b: Exhaust internal mechanisms and procedures, if available
options.c: Obtain legal representation
options.d: File a police report

questions.question: What does the Act require an employer to do upon receiving a sexual harassment claim against a client?

options.a: Ignore the claim if it involves a client
options.b: Take appropriate action to bring the matter to the client's attention
options.c: Immediately terminate the client's contract
options.d: Pay compensation to the victim

questions.question: Who is responsible for ensuring that students, residents, wards, inmates, patients, or members of an institution are not sexually harassed?

options.a: Local law enforcement
options.b: The person in charge of the institution
options.c: Human resources department
options.d: The complainant

questions.question: What does the Act define as 'sexual advance'?

options.a: Any romantic gesture between co-workers
options.b: Physical contact of a sexual nature, demand for sex, sexual suggestions, and other conduct of a sexual nature
options.c: Only verbal requests for sexual favors
options.d: Compliments about appearance

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Reference: Section 2(1), definition of 'sexual advance')

questions.question: Who is defined as a 'complainant' under the Act?

options.a: Any person who feels uncomfortable at work
options.b: Any person who makes a complaint pursuant to the provisions of this Act
options.c: Only workers who have been sexually harassed
options.d: Only clients who have faced harassment from workers

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Reference: Section 2(1), definition of 'complainant')
